name: Alarm Clock
memory: Alice has set me to Alarm at 7:01
description: 1. An alarm clock is an electronic device used to set and sound an alarm at a specific time to wake up the user.
2. It typically consists of a clock display and alarm sound output.
3. The alarm sound can be adjusted in terms of volume and tone.
4. The alarm setting can be changed by the user manually using the buttons or knobs on the device.
5. Some alarm clocks may have additional features, such as a snooze button to delay the alarm for a few minutes.
6. Once set, the alarm will sound at the designated time unless manually turned off by the user.
7. In some cases, the alarm clock may be able to automatically adjust for daylight saving time changes or changes in time zones without human intervention.
